boardgame.name: Giants Forge Halls
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

These giant forge halls are a dangerous place, but if you can survive the dangers of this dungeon, you will be rewarded with great treasures.

Built by giants, these forge halls contain many secrets that only the most cunning adventurers can discover. Many non-giants have tried to sneak in and steal the creations of these huge beings, but none have ever returned alive. Will you be able to find your way through?

You’ll need all your wits about you as well as some luck on your side if you want to make it out alive. But don’t worry! If you do manage to escape with treasure in hand, we promise that it will be worth every second of fear and danger!

boardgame.name: Wellspring Refugee Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Need a battlemap with refugees?

This map is perfect for any campaign. It’s got everything you could want in an adventure setting, from beautiful waterways to lush vegetation and even some ramshackle living areas! You can use this map to run your own one-shot side-quest (the adventure prompt included will help you get started right away) or weave it into your campaign's larger story.

We know that running a game of D&D can be stressful enough without having to worry about creating the right atmosphere with maps. So go ahead and buy Overgrown Wellspring Temple now! You won’t regret it, as it’s sure to make your games even better than ever before.

boardgame.name: Undercity Sewage Management Facility
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Looking for a new battlemap in the undercity?

This is the perfect map for any DM who wants to run an adventure in a sewer. It’s filled with all sorts of dangers, including thugs and thieves that are waiting to attack! The sewers themselves are dark and damp, with water dripping from pipes overhead while waterways flow thick with waste below. Adventure prompt included so you can easily run a one-shot adventure!

Adventure awaits (huzzah!) those who seek it out in this undercity sewer management facility. If you want to bring your party into the sewers and have them fight their way through hordes of enemies, then this is definitely the map for you! You won’t be disappointed by how easy it makes running adventures or how many hours of entertainment it provides.

With just one purchase, you get everything needed to start playing right away – no need for additional purchases or downloads! Just print or set it up in your favorite VTT program and play as soon as possible. We promise our maps are worth every penny!

boardgame.name: Polluted Waterworks
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Ready to run a one-shot adventure in a fantasy setting?

Polluted Waterworks is the perfect map for any DM looking to run an adventure in an abandoned, overgrown town. The deserted city has been overtaken by nature, and wild animals are running rampant through the streets. What caused this disaster? And why are these animals so vicious? Adventure prompt included!

You won’t have to worry about coming up with your own story for this map. Just use our pre-made adventure prompt and you can focus on creating immersive encounters for your players instead of worrying about what comes next. This map pack will save you hours of time that would otherwise be spent trying to come up with something new from scratch!

Click Add to Cart now for instant access to this battlemap and the adventure prompt that comes with it, so you can start playing as soon as you like.

boardgame.name: Madame Mimble's Star Codex
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In Madame Mimble’s Star Codex, you’ll find lists of alien races, sci-fi classes, weapons, armors, and more for use with your Micro Sci-Fi RPG games.

These simple options can add a lot of flavor and different options and inspirations to your game.

boardgame.name: Right Cruel and Fell: Condottiero – Italian supplement, 1300-1492
boardgame.description:
Condottiero is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers wars in Italy from 1300-1492ce - the great age of the mercenary soldier during the Italian Renaissance.
Like RC&F, Condottiero contains historical orders of battle.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars of the Guelphs and Ghibellines
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Right Cruel and Fell: Wargame Rules for field battles of the Hundred Years War

boardgame.name: Micro Sci-Fi RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Micro Sci-Fi RPG system is an ultra-simple dark sci-fi roleplaying game that is designed specifically for solo play. Take on the role of a lone space traveler, scouting away missions, killing aliens, gathering credits, and becoming an interplanetary hero! These basic rules are the definitive rules for the system and are all you need to play any adventure for the system. They are considered the new 1.75 edition rules, but remain completely compatible with all the other game content in the system.
This book includes: Rules for Sci-fi Characters Rules for Space Travel Rules for Ship Combat Rules for Multi-Planet Exploration Rules for Planet Colonization Rules for inserting any other Micro Chapbook RPG genre book (current and upcoming) And more!

boardgame.name: Right Cruel and Fell: Help, Defend, Heal – Supplement for the Teutonic Knights 1225-1410
boardgame.description:
Help, Defend Heal is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers the Teutonic Knights and other military-religious orders and their eastern opponents, such as the Balts, Russians, Lithuanians and Poles (but not the Mongols).
Like RC&F, HDH contains orders of battle, both historical and hypothetical.
In addition to the topical terrain generation rules, there is an accurate map of the large Grunwald battlefield.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Right Cruel and Fell: Wargame Rules for field battles of the Hundred Years War

boardgame.name: Right Cruel and Fell: Livery and Maintenance – War of the Roses supplement
boardgame.description:
Livery and Maintenance is a supplement to Right Cruel and Fell which adds troop types, new actions, and special rules to extend the timeframe and geographic location of the basic rules.

This supplement covers the War of the Roses.

Like RC&F, L&M contains orders of battle, both historical and hypothetical.

The basic rules set of RC&F is necessary to play this supplement.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Right Cruel and Fell: Wargame Rules for field battles of the Hundred Years War

boardgame.name: Gung-Ho: Marine Raiders on Makin Island, 1942
boardgame.description:
The US Marine Raiders make their debut with a surprise raid on the Japanese-held atoll of Makin Island.
Will these daring "gung-ho" Americans carry the day or be driven back into the sea by the dogged Japanese defenders?

This campaign is designed to be used with Too Fat Lardies Chain of Command and can also be readily adapted to your preferred WWII miniature ruleset.

Contained in this book you will find:

Complete campaign setup, duration, and special rules to add variation to play
Platoon layouts for both US and Japanese forces, as well as campaign-specific Support Lists
Four scenarios based on period maps and satellite imagery
Pre-generated character names, custom Patrol Markers, and National Characteristics


–description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Chain of Command

boardgame.name: Musketry Like Thunder 2: More Great Civil War Battles Never Fought
boardgame.description:
Musketry Like Thunder 2 provides twelve fictional Civil War miniature gaming scenarios, from small introductory games to corps level actions.

Each provides a unique tactical problem often encountered by the armies fighting the war.
These range from command and control issues, surmounting difficult terrain, to combating the weather as well as each other.
In addition, each scenario has great replay potential.
Federals and Confederates can switch deployment areas, and you can modify the order of battle to represent different years during the war.
In fact, you can use the maps and deploy entirely different forces on the table!

Try something new, where your opponent doesn't know everything about your army's deployment, strengths, and leadership before the game even starts!

These scenarios are designed to be used with almost any American Civil War regimental or brigade level set of rules. Rules are included for figures based on 20, 30, 40, 50, and 100 historic men per figure/stand. Times are given for 10, 15, and 20 minutes per game turn.
Maps are in full color, as are the numerous color photographs of the modern battlefield.
This book does not contain rules for playing miniature wargames.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Johnny Reb III: Regimental Grand Tactical American Civil War Miniatures Rules
Regimental Fire and Fury

boardgame.name: Cold War 3! Gulf States: Gulf Wars – Saudi Arabia, Bahrain, UAE, Jordan & Oman
boardgame.description:
GULF STATES: Saudi Arabia, bahrain, UAE, Jordan and Oman covers the smaller Gulf States for the Gulf War (Op. Desert Storm/Op. Granby) in 1991 and beyond.
The contents of this book can be used to recreate the 1st and 2nd Saudi Brigades and the Gulf Coalition Forces.
ALL equipment and personnel used by all of the Gulf States is included.
Omani Challenger I's, Bahraini M60a3's, Saudi M1a1's, UAE AMX-30's, the ubiquitous M109a1, Rapier Air defence missiles, Scorpion and Scimitar reccee vehicles, Croatale SAM's and the M16/M4, M60a2, SAW and MILAN ATGM's equipping your ground forces.

Also included are three fun scenarios, including an assault by Saudi Forces across the causeway to Bahrain in a "what if" scenario; Gulf Co-Alition forces on Highway-40 to Kuwait City Vs. Iraqi forces and a rescue the hostages scenario against insurgents in yemen by Oamani forces.

Air power is included with F5/Tiger II's, the ubiquitous F-16, Jaguar and Mirage 2000 fighter jets providing much needed air support.

Invade Kuwait! Push back the Iraqis (available soon as a seperate book: GULF WARS: Wars In The Gulf 1990-2020); liberate Kuwait, push onwards into Iraq -or engage in any number of "what If" scenarios.

Operating a small Gulf States force is fun and brings an added element to your COLD WAR3! games.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Cold War 3! Rules for Modern Warfare 1960-1990: 4th Edition

boardgame.name: World War Z: Aftermath
boardgame.description:
World War Z: Aftermath is the ultimate co-op zombie shooter based on Paramount Pictures’ blockbuster film, and the next evolution of the original hit World War Z that has now captivated over 15 million players. Turn the tide of the zombie apocalypse across consoles and PC with full cross-play. Join up to three friends or play on your own with AI teammates against hordes of ravenous zombies in intense story episodes across new zombie-ravaged locations around the world: Rome, Vatican City and Russia’s Kamchatka peninsula.

World War Z: Aftermath is out now for PlayStation®4, Xbox One, and PC alongside backwards compatibility for PlayStation®5 and Xbox Series X at 4K and 60FPS. For our longtime WWZ community, you can purchase and play the Aftermath upgrade at a discounted price on PlayStation, Xbox and EGS stores.

World War Z: Aftermath Deluxe Edition, featuring a bonus weapons pack and weapons skins, is also available now. In early 2022, the game will receive further next-gen enhancements, with support for PS5 and XSX|S console features, as well as Horde Mode XL, free and on PC, PS5, and XSX|S.

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: A Tale of Bravery: Demo Game
boardgame.description:
A free print and play, story driven adventure game for 1 to 4 players set in fantasy Britain some 20 years after the death of King Arthur Pendragon.

Each separate game session, or “quest” as it is called in the game, takes about 1 hour to play. Each quest can be won, lost, or even forfeited. The game is over when you have played through all quests listed in a separate questbook.

Each one of the players controls a “hero”. There are four heroes to the so called “party”. The players win the game if they manage to complete the goals of all the quests of the game.

The players will take turns reading aloud from the questbook. At regular intervals the players are allowed to make decisions on where to go and what to do. This affects the outcome of the game session. Whenever a fight occurs, it is played out on a game board made of separate modular tiles. The combat system is quick and focused on tactics and using the hero’s abilities to survive.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Theme: King Arthur / The Knights of the Round Table / Camelot

boardgame.name: The Flood Priest's Garden
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In a garden, once used as a holy site by members of the Order of the Green Mice, sits a pond and a large apple tree, as well as a dark secret. From the depths of the pond a catfish has seduced a wizened mouse mage into doing his dark bidding. High atop his tower in the apple tree, the Flood Priest uses magic from the deep to flood all of the garden and turn it into the realm of the catfish. Strange creatures have emerged from the water and the mice of Terra-Potta are fleeing the garden in droves. There are some who think If proper alliances are made, the catfish can be taken down or the flood priest can be stopped. Rumors have been stirring that the end is near, and all will soon become the Flood Priest’s Garden.

boardgame.name: Influencer Card Game
boardgame.description:
The fast paced strategic card game that goes viral. Get the most followers and secure the influencer contract. But be aware, not everyone will agree with your posts and you may get blocked, hacked or loose posts to copyright claims. Don't get caught with misconduct or your followers will leave you.

Influencer - The viral card game of the social media world. Be the player to acquire the biggest social media following to secure the influencer contract deal.  

Each player draws and discards cards to accumulate followers. Players can also play cards against their opponents to take away their followers.

The game ends when any one player has reached 100k followers, any player may play the influencer contract card on their turn to end the game.

At the end of the game, the player with the biggest social media following after deductions wins the game. You cannot win if your account is blocked.

boardgame.name: Sluggish Morss: Pattern Circus
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Claymation point-and-click adventure game set in a dark and cryptic future

boardgame.name: Las Vegan
boardgame.description:
Welcome to Las Vegan! Manage your hand of cards correctly to lose your coins as slowly as possible! The Casino always wins!

In Las Vegan, cards in 4 colors numbered from 0 to 9 are dealt to the players. The first player lays down any card from his hand. The other players have to play cards of the same color if they have them, the highest value win the deal. If they don't have the color, they can discard a card of another color or play a 0 from another color to win the deal. When all the cards have been played, the round is over and it's time to score. Certain coin and card combinations will score points and a chance to spin the wheel to earn coins.

The game ends at the end of the 4th round or when a player has lost all his coins. The one with most coins win the game.

Las Vegan is a trick taking game from Baptiste Laurent, Corentin Lebrat, and Ludovic Maublanc.

boardgame.name: First Rat
boardgame.description:
For generations, the rats in the old junkyard have been telling each other the great legend about a moon made out of cheese and they want nothing more than to reach this inexhaustible treasure. One day, the little rat children discovered a comic in the junkyard that described the first landing on the moon, and thus the plan was born: Build a rocket and take over the cheese moon!

Fortunately, the junkyard has everything the rats need to build their rocket, and the other animals are willing to support this daring venture — at least if they're well paid. Of course, all the rats work together to achieve this mighty goal. However, each rat family competes to build the most rocket parts and to train the most rattronauts so they can feast on as much of the lunar cheese as possible.

In First Rat, each player starts with two rats and may raise two more. On your turn, you either move one of your rats 1-5 spaces on the path or move 2-4 of your rats 1-3 spaces each as long as they end up on spaces of the same color. Your rats can never share the same space, and if you land in a space with another player's rat, you must pay them one cheese, borrowing cheese from the back as needed. After movement, you collect resources (cheese, tin cans, apple cores, baking soda, etc.) matching the color of the space you occupy or move your lightbulb along the light string, which will boost your income in future turns. (More lights in the junkyard makes it easier for you to find things!)

If you end movement near a store, you can spend resources to buy a backpack or bottle top — or you can steal an item instead, with the rat then returning to the start of the movement track. You can also spend resources to build rocket sections (and score points) or spend cheese in bulk as a donation (and score points).

When you pick up apple cores, you move around the rat burrow to pick up comics or stored food or raise one of your rats from the nursery. Alternatively, you automatically get a new rat when one of your rats reaches the launch pad and boards the spaceship. When a player places their fourth rat on the spaceship — or places their eighth scoring marker on the board — the game ends, and the player with the most points wins. In the event of a tie, the tied player with the most rattronauts in the rocket wins.

First Rat includes a solo mode as well as variable game set-ups described in the rulebook.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 1 bis 5 Spieler Spieldauer: 50 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 10+
First Rat Seit Generationen erzählen sich die Ratten auf dem alten Schrottplatz die Legende vom Käsemond. Nun steht der Plan: Sie werden eine Rakete bauen und den Käsemond in Besitz nehmen! Zwar müssen die Ratten zusammenarbeiten, aber die Rivalität zwischen den Rattenfamilien ist ungebrochen: Denn die Familie, die die meisten Raketenteile baut und die mutigsten Rattonauten ausbildet, wird auch den größten Anteil vom lunaren Käseschmaus abbekommen.
First Rat ist ein Kennerspiel für bis zu fünf Personen, das auch solo gespielt werden kann. Zahlreiche Strategien, besondere Fähigkeiten und ein variabler Aufbau machen jede Partie aufs Neue spannend. In jedem Zug müssen die Spielenden entscheiden, ob sie lieber eine Ratte bis zu fünf Felder weit bewegen oder stattdessen mehrere Ratten bis zu drei Felder weit laufen lassen – dabei dürfen die Ratten aber nur auf Feldern der gleichen Farbe ihre Bewegung beenden. Und wenn dort schon Ratten der Konkurrenz stehen, kostet es auch noch einen Käse pro fremde Ratte! Unterwegs sammeln die Spielenden Ressourcen, erwerben (oder stehlen) nützliche Gegenstände, bauen Teile der Rakete oder bilden Rattonauten aus, um möglichst viele Siegpunkte zu ergattern.
Inhalt: 1 Spielplan 22 Holzratten 74 Holzteile 22 Karten 255 Plättchen 1 Wertungsblock 5 Spielhilfen 1 Beiblatt 1 Anleitung
https://youtu.be/gpabgtv5NSw
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE,EN

boardgame.name: Candy Gremlins
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore the peculiar basement of a magic-filled candy shop in this light-hearted candy-themed adventure for any fantasy ttrpg system.

This mini-dungeon also features 3 new monsters, a handful of candy-themed spells, and twelve magical candies for your party to enjoy.

What this is

A system-neutral adventure based around stealing magical candies
Intended for somewhat chaotic characters


What this isn't

A super serious adventure filled with deep roleplay
Recommended by 9 out of 10 dentists

boardgame.name: SteamPUNKS
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Put the PUNK in steampunk. In this troika adventure, you will take on the empire as a group of rebels trying to free a debtor's prison.

Inside you will find

1 Adventure
5 Stackblocks
1 Damage Matrix
d66 Name table

boardgame.name: Cosmic Whalefall
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

36 Backgrounds to use in any troika game.

Play backgrounds like

Unformed Knight
Werevetranarian
Brain Slug
Heretical Pyromancer
and 32 more!

boardgame.name: Von Hynd Manor
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A location of noble predation aways you in this pamphlet!

Somewhere deep in the woods lies the manor of the von Hynd family. There you will find a forsaken family, rotting away as their noble station allows, preying on the people in their lycanthropic form.

Inside you will find

6 NPCs
An abstract map of the manor
An Exotic Plant Generator
Rules for modifying hex crawls around the area
6 Encounters for Hex Crawls.

boardgame.name: Play Your Cards Right: Super Powers! Super Science!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play Your Cards Right: Super Powers Super Science is the second issue of a periodical fanzine made for use of the capers system by nerdburger games. This issue has 5 additional powers to use for characters, an additional character creation option. On top of that, there are rules for various dubious science tropes found in comics media includes rules for bringing back dinosaurs.

boardgame.name: Play Your Cards Right: In the Astral Plane
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Play Your Cards Right: In the Astral Plane is the first issue of a fanzine made for use of the capers system by nerdburger games. This explores alternate dimensions that can be found and traveled to that are. The alternate earths mentions in this fanzine are the cartoonish Aesop Earth, the devastated remains of Atomic Earth, the water world of Aquarian Earth, and the futuristic world of Deisel Earth, as well as the table an infinite casino floating on the back of a turtle in the astral plane.

On top of some light setting stuff, the zine also includes mechanical backings for having irradiated characters, a collection of creatures you may find in the atomic ruins, a set of stats for various dieselpunk vehicles, and rules to use for mechs.

boardgame.name: Index Card RPG: Master Edition
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Index Card RPG has slowly built a die-hard following of DIY RPG creators and players over the past 5 years. Until now, it has been found in 3 hardcopy books and numerous PDF's published by Runehammer.

This newest edition, the MASTER EDITION, combines ICRPG's numerous worlds, streamlined D20 rules and critically acclaimed GM know-how all in one PDF, all revised and updated with its latest playtest data, magic system, LOOT tables and so much more.


400 pages of DIY goodness: a D20 system YOU command
All 5 main ICRPG worlds: Fantasy, Sci-Fi, Weird West, Superheroes and Ice Age
Newly rebuilt advanced magic system
Huge monster listing
Collection of d100 LOOT tables and content creation tables
Includes FREE 150 page ADVENTURES supplement: all previously published adventures in one
Includes portrait and landscape character sheets

boardgame.name: Aliens For RPG's
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some alien races for use in RPG's such as Stars Without Number they could be fitted into any campaign. The description largely show what humanity knows of these races leaving plenty of room to customise them to your particular campaign.

boardgame.name: Animal Encounters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ideas for creating animal encounters in science fiction RPG's such as Stars Without Number there are ideas for creatures in specific habitats so your encounters actually look like the animals belong where they are met.

While created with Stars Without Number in mind this could probably be used with most science fiction rules.

boardgame.name: Asgard Sector
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A sector for use in Stars Without Number includes a sector map and descriptions of the twenty planets in the sector. A variety of different worlds some rich and prosperous some barren and inhospitable plenty of ideas for setting adventures within the sector such as espionage exploring ancient ruins or just ferrying cargo.

While written for Stars Without Number this would probably work with other systems as well.

boardgame.name: Patrons
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A selection of patrons for science fiction role playing games such as Stars Without Number, they can hire the players for a variety of tasks and could in some cases drag the players into their personel affairs.

boardgame.name: Planet Hengis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A planet for use in science fiction RPG's such as Traveller or Stars Without Number it is written in a way that allows it to be used with any rule system.

Hengis is a major trade centre and a generally nice place to live there is however a lot of smuggling and other possible adventures to keep any visitors busy.

boardgame.name: Planetary Tags Some Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Ideas for some of the planetary tags used in Stars Without Number Revised Edition although written with these rules in mind they could be used with many different science fiction role playing games. Ideal for people looking for some inspiration or who need to flesh out a few worlds quickly.

boardgame.name: Planetary Tags Even More Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

More ideas for the planetary tags used in Stars Without Number The Revised Edition ideal if you have a whole sector to create and you need some ideas or if your campaign heads of in an unexpected direction and you need something quickly. These ideas could be used in most sets of science fiction rules not just Stars Without Number.

boardgame.name: Planetary Tags Some More Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some more ideas for the planetary tags in Stars Without Numbers Revised Edition while written for these rules they could easily be used with other rules such as Traveller. Ideal if you need to make a planet sound interesting in a hurry.

boardgame.name: Planetary Tags Yet More Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some more ideas to use with Stars Without Number The Revised Edition, while based on the planetary tags in Stars Without Number most of these ideas could be used in a variety of science fiction role playing games.

boardgame.name: Shipping Cargo The Problems
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ideas for shipping cargo in Sci-Fi role playing games such as Stars Without Number, there are a lot of problems that can occur when shipping cargo as well as a few basic scenario ideas using some of these problems.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of Starship and system ship designs for use with Stars Without Number Revised Edition written by Kevin Crawford, there are 11 ship designs for you to use. They range from a simple merchantman through an asteroid miner a passenger liner and a couple of modified merchantmen for those interested in smuggling and piracy.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some new ship hulls for Stars Without Number Revised Edition as well as a few new ship designs based on these hulls. Many of the new ship hulls are quite similar to existing types and represent the need for specific types depending on the circumstances that a particular systems finds itself in.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some more ship designs for use in Stars Without Number Revised Edition various mostly civilian ship types including several unusual types of merchant ship.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 4
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some more ships to use in Stars Without Number The Revised Edition a mixture of civilian and military designs. Includes a two man fighter, a food production ship an assault ship to transport troops into battle and several other assorted designs.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 5
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A selection of ship designs for use with Stars Without Number Revised Edition, these are all old designs of ships still in service usually on backwater worlds.

There are nine different ships in total ranging from a fighter up to a large bulk freighter.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 6
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of ship designs for Stars Without Number the revised edition, these all use none standard hulls that first appeared in Starships and Spacecraft 2, I have repeated the basic hull designs here for easy reference there are a total of 7 new ship designs one for each of the hull types.

boardgame.name: Starships and Spacecraft 7
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A selection of ship designs for the revised edition of Stars Without Number, these are all pre collapse ships so not vessels in wide spread use. Ideal for setting a scenario around perhaps tracking down information about the location of a long lost ship.

boardgame.name: Worlds Of Adventure
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of basic stats for aproximately 160 planets for use in Stars Without Number Revised Edition, more than enough for most people just pick out the ones you want to quickly create a sector for your players to explore. While they were randomly created with the rules in the book any anomolous results have been edited to give planets that are plausable.

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collection of creatures to use in Worlds Without Number for people who want to have a more traditional style background.

It includes trolls, dragons, ogres and various other stuff including some normal animals that couls appear in your games.

boardgame.name: Ruins Tags Some Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ideas for the Ruins Tags used in the Other Dust RPG written by Kevin Crawford, ideal if you need some inspiration or have to put something together quickly. There are multiple ideas for 10 of the tags provided in the rules.

boardgame.name: Enclave Tags Some Ideas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Some ideas for the enclave tags used in Other Dust written by Kevin Crawford, ideal to spark the imagination or if you need some ideas in a hurry. There are a number of ideas for 10 of the enclave tags used in the rules.

boardgame.name: Zombie Puppies: A Barktastic Strategic Battle Card Game
boardgame.description:
An Ebola research lab in Luanda, Angola in the 1980s. Through unfortunate chained circumstances (a professor, a snail and a cat are said to have been involved), a deadly virus breaks out, infecting only cute puppy dogs and mutating them into zombies!

You can play this dynamic card game with 2-5 players, regardless of their language. Zombie Puppies can be learned in 5-10 minutes, requires strategic thinking, and gives you a whole new card game experience.

And this is how you play it: With Zombie Puppies you acquire a set of cards which consists of healing, action, and infection cards. Each round involves drawing new cards, infecting your opponent and protecting or healing yourself.

You can win either by keeping your own puppy alive despite being under constant attack or by being the first to get a hold of the healing serum - which is only possible with the right strategy!

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Stingbad!: Mass Skirmish Fantasy Wargame Rules
boardgame.description:
Stingbad is a set of Fantasy wargame rules developed as part of a new series covering different periods.
They were developed from the pedigree of our popular Sacre Bleu massed skirmish rules, using a variable sequence of play which means even underdogs stand a chance of winning.

The rules stand alone, no other sets in the series are required, but all those in the Streamlined Play Rules Series share a core set of rules, so if you learn one picking up another one of the rules in the series is easy. Each set is, of course, heavily tweaked for the period they cover and are streamlined for fast play. We want our games to be straightforward, so we can concentrate on trying to defeat our tabletop enemy insted of spending our time 'fighting' the rules to get them to work! That is central to the design philosophy of these wargame rules.

In the case of Stingbad, included are three ways of choosing armies, and the features include amongst other things flexible unit sizes, different types of battle, weather rules, commander ratings, fluke hits, heroes and speeches, collapsing buildings, smoke and - as you'd expect - magic rules. Magic can be powerful, it can cause hills to rise up or collapse, and trees to animate and become walking creatures and water to rage for instance, all assuming you can get the magic to work!

The rules have taken years to develop, during which keeping them simple and not complicating things was a major challenge. They can be used with as many or as few figures as you want (individually based, that is!).

We hope you decide to give them a go, and enjoy leading your hordes to ultimate victory, or even to glorious defeat... ?!

–Description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Sacre Bleu!: Mass Skirmish Wargame Rules for the Age of Pirates, Reason & Wayfare! – 17th & 18th Centuries + Napoleonic Wars

boardgame.name: The Lord of the Rings: Rise to War
boardgame.description:
User Summary

A game where you play as the evil side in the war of the ring.

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 07
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A bard from a neighboring kingdom has escaped a brutal repression
A monarch wants to blackmail a political rival just so they "can watch the country burn"
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 08
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

The avatar of the god of growth wants your help in restoring a jungle
A veteran wants to turn a battlefield into a memorial site
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 09
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Baltro the Unlucky wants to help you steal a ship
Two artists want the next magic tattoo
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: Story Seeds Collection 10
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes you need a quick story for your players. Not a complete campaign, or even an adventure, but something you can modify to fit your table. You need a Story Seed.

DRP Story Seed Collections feature two different ideas complete enough to build a session around, yet open enough that you can add/change details, and make it your own. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description as the base of your own adventure.

This system-agnostic collection includes:

A walled estate in a tiny town holds a treasure everyone wants
The town of Gwendish wants your party to protect it from bandits
boardgame.rpgseries: Dark Raptor Press Story Seeds Collections

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 10
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes new members of the ship Wavecrest:

Hashan Direseek - male gnome ranger
Barboa - female halfling fighter
Thrisska - female infernal bard
Mak Tottle - female dark gnome sorceress

boardgame.name: NPCs Collection 11
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your players' characters will run into many people during the course of a gaming session. Some will be less than memorable, and some will die at the hands of the party, or other NPCs. But some interactions call for more than a name and job title.

DRP NPC Collections feature four different character descriptions, along with their portraits. Use them as-is, flesh them out, or use just the description or the portrait. Don't be caught off guard when your players say, "We want to talk with this character!"

This system-agnostic collection includes:

Lord Kalmak - male dark gnome ranger
Bantrub Smokesoul - male infernal wizard
Zarba'at Stoneswallow - female dwarven outcast
Arkeef of the Paladoni - male dark dwarf druid

boardgame.name: Adventure Sandbox 04
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Adventure Sandboxes are a location with a map. Suggested hooks could give characters a reason to visit. You'll also find information about NPCs, geographic features, and situations for your players to discover.

Please note: a Sandbox is NOT a complete adventure! It's a location with details for players to discover and interact with. Sandboxes are game sytem neutral, meaning you can use almost any system you like to run a game there.

This 4-page Sandbox covers Free Crossing, a small town on the Puttasca River. Characters can discover The Black Cat - a popular inn run by a tabaxi ex-adventurer; Farkus, the halfling that runs most of the crime in town; a building with a suspiciously dry basement, and much more. You'll also get access to 6 NPCs, including an elven cleric, a baker's assistant, a master blacksmith, and more. PLUS: a larger map of Free Crossing which you can print or use on a VTT, and a BONUS sheet of NPC opponents!

boardgame.name: Hungry Life: North America
boardgame.description:
Hungry Life is an environmental education and awareness card game played between 2-5 players and for the whole family, schools and holidays.

It comes in two versions: A Europe continent (English, French, German) and a North America continent (English) featuring species unique to that continent.

Each player starts with their own deck of 20 cards plus five in their hand (player count dependant). You start by placing a primary producer/Base Card to create a new habitat. Each animal card will list what it can eat leading up to an apex predator. Each new habitat is connected as the game goes on, but with human projects such as roads and housing estates these habitats can become disconnected. Animals that could once be moved are now trapped. You must strategically place your animals, human projects and natural events to thwart your opponents.

The game mechanics have been designed to practically demonstrate how humans are causing issues but also how we can help in a simple and family friendly game lasting 25 - 45min.

Each animal card will also feature data about that animal so you can learn things like their weight, population size/trend as well as where they fall on the endangered species list.
In the rules you'll also find a list of organisations that are working hard to protect our natural world.

The first player to place all their cards wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Mythic Mischief: Witches Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Witches Expansion for Mythic Mischief adds a new playable Mythic Faction to the game, giving you a new asymmetric set of abilities with which to outsmart your opponents.

An extra-curricular coven, these bad-witches are pretty, petty, powerful, and proud! When you see them coming, you better get running because these sharp-tongued teens have taken down the toughest of terrors with crafty spells and questionable gossip.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mythic Mischief

boardgame.name: Mythic Mischief: Trolls Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Trolls Expansion for Mythic Mischief adds a new playable Mythic Faction to the game, giving you a new asymmetric set of abilities with which to outsmart your opponents.

This subterranean theatre troupe just finished their underground rendition of “Shakesfeare in the dark” to much critical (parental) acclaim. These loud-mouthed monsters can usually be found singing in the cafeteria or hiding out in the theatre room.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mythic Mischief

boardgame.name: Mythic Mischief: Ghosts Expansion
boardgame.description:
These wispy wallflowers are quite the quirky crew. Thik framed glasses, ironic shirts and bad indie bands, these spirits haunt the halls of their school where they rival the trendiest of spectral spooks. Guaranteed these ghastly faux-geeks liked your favorite band before they were ghoul.

The free expansion will feature the Gamefound exclusive glow-in-the-dark version of the ghost miniatures, never to be made again.

The Ghost faction will not be sold at retail and will only be available through IV's store or at cons, and will not be sold at a discount. Future versions of the ghost expansion will not feature glow-in-the-dark miniatures.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Mythic Mischief

boardgame.name: Mythic Mischief: Headmaster's Box
boardgame.description:
In Mythic Mischief, you play as a faction of Mythic Manor students competing to get as many of the other students caught by the Tomekeeper as you can without getting caught yourself.

Each Faction has its own unique set of abilities to move around the board, move the other factions into the path of the Tomekeeper, and even alter the course of the Tomekeeper by moving bookshelves.

Players are able to upgrade their Faction’s abilities throughout the game by collecting powerful Tomes from around the library.

The winner is the first Team to score 10 Mischief Points or the Team with the most points when the Tomekeeper finishes returning all of the Tomes after lunch!

—description from the publisher

The Headmaster's Box is a Gamefound Exclusive. Includes all current expansions in one box. Extra library components for 2v2 Blitz Mode and 7-player tournaments.

This item consists of:
1x Mythic Mischief Headmaster Box
1x Mythic Mischief Base Box Components
1x Extra set of Library Components
1x Ghosts Expansion
1x Trolls Expansion
1x Witches Expansion
1x Headmaster Game Trayz Inserts

Will NOT be for sale after the campaign!

boardgame.name: Mickey and Friends: Food Fight
boardgame.description:
A nostalgic invitation to play inspired by the Mickey Short “No Service”! It’s a carefree day at the beach with your favorite Disney friends, until a lunchtime food fight ensues! Get in on a chaos of concessions by tossing different dishes and treats from the Snack Shack to clear your tray the fastest!

Simultaneously roll dice and follow what types of food to toss, how many, and in which direction… while avoiding others’ food! Empty your tray and be the first player with three Mickey Medals to win the Mickey and Friends Food Fight!

listing.notes: Shipping via USPS Flat Rate, UPS, or Local Pick up in store (343 S. Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211) We are an online AND brick and mortar game shop located in the Los Angeles Area. The store is a labor of love between friends and brought to you by avid gamers. We TRULY appreciate your business! - Blue Gnome Games

boardgame.name: Bee War
boardgame.description:
Bee War is a competitive tile colocation game, where the opponents will fight to be the first to bring the queen bee to the panel. The worker bees, bumblebees and wasps will be our allies to achieve our goals by using the available cards in the most optimal way to achieve victory. But beware, in Bee War no strategy is long term, check the score of your cards and minimize the damage when chance brings you an unexpected card.

On their turn, a player picks a a card and play their cards. If the card allows it, you can move on the tiles the queen bee.
We have defensive cards and attack cards, they must be used wisely. The game ends, when the queen arrives at her panel. The first player who is able to bring his queen to his panel wins.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Mischief of Faction
boardgame.description:
Mischief of Faction is a social deduction megagame where players work with their friends and neighbors to advance their agenda by passing policies and gerrymandering district lines to gain political advantage.

In Mischief of Faction, players win by passing their faction's policies or scoring points for their home district.

Play is divided into two phases: "voting" and "policy". During the voting phase, all players vote on players to represent them in the capitol during the policy phase. During the policy phase, players discard policy cards based in a reverse draft (players discard instead of keeping cards.)

Players win when their role card's objectives are complete. This is variable across four groups. Generally speaking, players want to score five policies for their faction or score five points for a district (most likely the one where they are located. Play continues until either a victory condition is met or 11 policies are in play.

With two routes to victory, players face interesting tradeoffs: help their agenda or help their district? All the while, players are moving from district to district, realigned to their new homes, new colleagues, and new alliances to build.

boardgame.name: Dungeon in a Box
boardgame.description:
Dungeon in a Box is a solo dungeon crawler game based around a deck of cards and a handful of dice. Take on the role of the mighty warrior and slash your way through the dungeon until you come face to face with the boss. Will you win the day or be left at the feet of your would-be victim to serve as a warning to any foolish enough to follow in your footsteps?

Dungeon in a Box offers many choices. Which dungeon will you enter? Will you fight the monsters in their rooms or flee? Will you press your luck or ensure victory? Do you drink your potions when you find them or save them? Blame the dice and rail against the cruelty of fates as much as you like but know that you have chosen your own path. You may get mad, you may get overly invested but one thing is for sure: you won't be able to stop until you find your victory.

boardgame.name: YAMSTR
boardgame.description:
Yamstr is a strategic version of the traditional Yam dice game.

Score points in the 4 dedicated columns by rolling specific combinations.
Make clever decisions and increase your chances of winning.

boardgame.name: Artistes Misérable
boardgame.description:
Artistes Misérables is a humorous race-to-the-bottom card game where each player is a 19th century artist, trying to create as many masterworks as possible before dying sick, broke and depressed. In other words, a historical simulation.

A player's muses are Poverty, Infirmity and Despair, represented by colored tokens. These are not only part of your score, they are a threshold that must be reached for the quality of certain paintings, e.g. "you must be this miserable to paint this masterpiece".

On their turn, a player can take two different actions from the following list:

1) Draw a token of any color
2) Play an Action on any player
3) Draw a card
4) Paint a painting

All of these are done in the form of dark humor, from glorying in the despair of being dumped to reveling in the poverty of gambling debts that you will take to your grave unpaid.

The game ends when a player succumbs to the weight of their combined poverty, infirmity and despair (a literal 'sudden death' ending), or when the deck runs out, in which case all the players are drafted into World War 1 and die a horrible death in the trenches of France.

Scoring is based on accumulated misery, and the quality and quantity of paintings you produced before your predictable and unlamented end.

boardgame.name: Making Manhattan
boardgame.description:
As a premier city planner, you’ve been called in for one of the most prestigious projects imaginable: the chance to remake Manhattan. Now it's time to share your vision for New York City’s most notable borough. Can you design the ideal layout? Planning makes perfect in Making Manhattan!

In Making Manhattan, players will take turns drafting cards to add to their tableau outlining their plan for Manhattan. Tableaus consist of Downtown, Midtown, and Uptown areas as well as Central Park. Once both players have completed their plan, players will score points based on the position of each drafted card, personal scoring conditions assigned at start, and how well they managed traffic through the borough. The player with the most points at the end of the game becomes New York’s top city planner and wins the game!

boardgame.name: Greedy Granny
boardgame.description:
Players swipe treats from Granny's tray and push the button on her chair - you never know when she will wake up and send her teeth soaring!

On your turn, you spin the spinner. Landing on green lets you steal a treat from Granny's tray and then press the button a number of times. Landing on purple makes you put a treat back on Granny's tray then press the button a number of times. Other symbols include losing a turn and stealing a treat from another player.

If pushing the button makes Granny wake up, the player who woke her returns all treats to the tray.

The first player to collect one of each treat wins the game!

boardgame.name: Borderlands: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery
boardgame.description:
Borderlands®: Mister Torgue's Arena of Badassery!™ a cooperative combat-action board game.

You and a team of Vault Hunters enter Mister Torgue’s Arena of Badassery™ to face off against his collection of skags, bandits, and assorted psychos. You can play a one-off battle filled with explosions, slaughter-splosions, sauce-plosions, and loot-splosions!!! Or play a series of deadly fights in campaign-mode that will see your Vault Hunter level up between games. Visit vending machines to buy better gear, advance your character using unique skill trees, equip epic new guns, and enter the next game even more BADASS than before!!! Just make sure your tough enough to take on the final boss, an Ultimate Murder-Machine, hellbent on sending you back to the borderlands as moist and meaty skag-snacks.

boardgame.name: SagaBorn Battles
boardgame.description:
SagaBorn Battles is a card based miniature game of player vs player skirmishing.

Join in a skirmish game that explores the world of the Dark Return as you compete to find ancient artifacts.
Battles can use any 28-32mm miniatures you already own, so all you need is the cards and some d8’s to begin!

The lands of Atheles have long been in a dark age, though now magic has begun to return. Adventurers, tomb raiders, and grave robbers search the lands for ancient relics of magic.

SagaBorn Battles uses miniatures you already own. Terrain can be 2d or 3d printed and is based on 1 inch.

Why play SagaBorn Battles?

Its fast. Set up and play takes around 30-45 minutes.
Its easy. You can learn the basics of the rules in 10 minutes.
A simple and fun dice system. One die to rule them all, combat outcome is determined in quick opposing rolls.
The lands of the Dark Return are full of peril and life, a world ready for adventure.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Master Potter
بازی فکری ایرانی سفالگر
boardgame.description:
Pottery is as old as humanity, and many culture have left their mark on it. However, Persian pottery is known as the epitome of art, creativity, and practicality coming together. Along the history many people have tried their hands at pottery. But it takes a master potter to create a timeless vessel, and there can’t be more than one master potter in each generation. And now the time has come to choose the master potter of your generation.

The Master Potter is a competitive worker placement game, in which 2 to 5 players take on the role of pottery masters. Players must send their apprentices to different spaces across the board to collect the essential materials and form and decorate different pottery utensils which are among the available requests. Creating a pottery utensil will grant points to its creator, and the player that reaches 20 points first, will be the winner of the game.

The game is played in consecutive rounds. Each player has 4 meeples, representing their apprentices. Each round begins Each round begins by players putting all their meeples on the board to collect resources, one at a time, until they are all placed. At that point all players collect their meeples, the first player marker is passed to next player in clockwise order, and the resource spaces are refilled and prepared for a new round.

Each requested pottery consists of a basic shape and two sets of ingredients, each of which may include different number of colors and patterns or even additional clay blocks for ornamentation. Clay blocks can be collected from different parts of the riverbank, colors and minerals are up for grabs at the market, and artists can be hired to add different ornamentation to the pottery. However, remember that if you go to a space before others, you will get a better choice and a lower price.

What will your pottery collection look like when this fierce competition is over?

boardgame.name: Prognosis Death
boardgame.description:
St. Muerte Hospital 10:00 pm -
A patient is admitted to the emergency ward with rapidly developing symptoms. Doctors rush to see the patient with morbid curiosity on the otherwise dull night...

Prognosis Death is a set-collection card game where each player is a doctor who is trying to take the credit for curing a patient. You’ll collect symptoms and use them to construct a diagnosis. You’ll challenge and outwit your rivals, and you’ll get the recognition you deserve – at any cost!

Your objective in Prognosis Death is to either have the lowest score remaining in your hand when the patient is discharged, or the highest score in the case that the patient succumbs to their illness and perishes.

At the start of every turn in Prognosis Death you’ll add symptoms to your hand by either drawing an unknown card from the deck, or by taking a card from the public discard area. At the end of every turn, you’ll have an opportunity to remove symptoms from your hand either by making a diagnosis, which consists of a set of matching symptoms, or by discarding a card to the public discard area.

Every symptom card has an effect that will either trigger when that card is discarded, or when you make a diagnosis with that card as the top-most card. Symptoms also have effects that will trigger when they are retrieved from the public discard area. Whether these effects help or hinder you will depend on the card!

Throughout the course of the game cards in each player’s hand will become revealed and will become accessible to players who can see them. For the most part you can use accessible cards in any player’s hand as though they were in your hand, but beware, cards that you have revealed become inaccessible to you - if it is still in your hand at the end of the game it will count towards your score.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Sherlock Holmes: Mystery Game – Jack the Ripper Affair
boardgame.description: A board game using a map of London, a dice, incident cards, a list of subjects to find who is Jack the Ripper. Roll the dice and move around the board, the space you land on pick a card and read the clue to help determine identity of Jack the Ripper or eliminate subjects.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: 二見書房 ( Futami Shobo Publishing Co., Ltd. )

boardgame.name: Ostia
boardgame.description:
Ostia is a strategy game for 1-4 players. Players lead a large fleet to explore the ocean, trade and develop the port.
Make good use of the Mancala system to strengthen your personal board and aim for the highest honor!

The player chooses one of the six spaces on his board.
Corresponding resources will be produced for the number of ships in that space.
After that, take all the ships in that space and place them one by one clockwise.
Take action corresponding to where the last one ship was placed.
By repeating this, you can build a new ship on your personal board, strengthen your ship to a larger one, or build a building in the harbor.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: 仙剑奇侠传—逍遥游 (Chinese Paladin: XiaoYaoYou)
boardgame.description:
With the collapse of the Tower of Imprisoned Demons, the thousands of demons once again rampaged the earth. To avoid being overwhelmed by the creatures, the Great God Nuwa used the magic of returning to the soul to create the Xiaoyao Illusion that temporarily trapping dangerous demons in it.

The celestial heroes of all time and space have received the message from Nuwa: Please come to the Illusion to conquer the demons and save the common people! The number of powerhouses with the highest merits will get my reward-go back in time and change the thing that makes you most regrettable. Therefore, the powerhouses from all walks of life have packed their bags and set off for the Xiaoyao Illusion.

The players are divided into two teams, A and B, according to the number of players in the game. Each player plays a different hero with special skills. Players take their turns one by one. A turn includes several phases, during which you can trigger event cards, play scrolls, and get equipped. The most important phase is the Battle Phase, during which you can trigger a battle with monsters. Your teammates can support you and your opponents can interfere. Cards and skills can be used to influence the battle. If you win, you get the winning effect and may keep the monster as your pet, otherwise, you have to get punished for losing.

After the monster deck is empty, the team with higher points from pets wins! You can also win by killing all your opponents. Don't forget the love stories from the main video game because the heroes won't hesitate to sacrifice their lives to save their lovers!

boardgame.name: A Time to Harvest
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

In 1929, a student died during an expedition in the Vermont Hills. One year later, the Miskatonic University is sending another team back to Vermont…


A full, 6-part campaign for novice and experienced players.
A primer on the people and places within Cobb’s Corners.
Guidance for creating student investigators.
Keeper and player resources, including a suite of handouts and maps.
10 pre-generated and ready-to-play characters.
Advice for running the campaign with Pulp Cthulhu.


First published as an Organised Play series, A Time to Harvest is available now for the first time in a complete and updated format.

boardgame.name: L'infanterie attaque !: Un jeu d'escarmouche durant la seconde guerre mondiale
boardgame.description:
L'infanterie attaque ! is a skirmish game for 2 to 6 players.
It invites you to relive the confrontations of the Second World War on a smaller scale than usual.
Far from the great mass battles, small clashes between small groups of men played a role that was sometimes crucial and not recounted in the history books.
In this game the individual soldier is honored and you will focus on following his progress as the battle progresses and sometimes accompany him until his death. We invite you to create the story of these anonymous people who have forged the world we live in at the cost of their lives.
The game includes a scenario generator with 288 possible combinations, 29 skills and 6 nations represented.
The campaign possibilities are therefore very numerous and not one part will be the same.
The figures can be of any brand.
The rules are written for 28mm but by dividing all the distances by 2 you can play in 15mm or even 1/72.
The playing surface can simply be your living room table, you can use a play mat.
For the terrain, leave room to your imagination. For more interesting games, the playing area should have a minimum of obstruction items to provide shelter and strategic stakes.

– Description (translated) from the publisher

boardgame.name: Les Voltigeurs: Le jeu d'escarmouche
boardgame.description:
Les Voltigeurs is a skirmish game for 2 to 6 players.
It invites you to relive the confrontations under the Napoleonic era on a smaller scale than usual.
Far from the great mass battles, small clashes between small groups of men played a role that was sometimes crucial and not recounted in the history books.
In this game the individual soldier is honored and you will focus on following his progress as the battle progresses and sometimes accompany him until his death.
We invite you to create the story of these anonymous people who have forged the world we live in at the cost of their lives.
The game includes a scenario generator with 288 possible combinations, 29 skills and 6 nations represented. The campaign possibilities are therefore very numerous and not one part will be the same.
The figures can be of any brand.
The rules are written for 28mm but by dividing all the distances by 2 you can play in 15mm or even 1/72.
The playing surface can simply be your living room table or you can use a play mat.
For the terrain, leave room to your imagination. For more interesting games, the playing area should have a minimum of obstruction items to provide shelter and strategic stakes.

– Description (Translated) from the publisher

boardgame.name: Blood & A Black Flag: Swashbuckling Skirmish Wargaming
boardgame.description:
Grab a brace of pistols and strap on your cutlass, as you head for the desperate and blighted isles of the Triangle in pursuit of untold wealth and power!

Decide who your hero is by equipping them with feats and influence, then recruit a ragged team of unsavoury ne'er-do-wells and do your best to bash them into something resembling an organized ccrew. Then take to the streets of Devil's Spit in a new skirmish wargame from the author of Horizon Wars and Horizon Wars: Zero Dark.

With a stripped-down style focused on tactical gameplay and decisive action, Blood & A Black Flag is a miniatures-agnostic skirmish game you can turn as easily to sci-fi space opera or sword and sorcery as you can to the golden age of piracy.

–description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Formation
boardgame.description: Formation is a light playing card-arranging strategy game for 2-4 players. Every player begins the game with 9 random cards dealt out in front of them, each with a suit and an ability. There are 15 suits and 5 abilities (switch, defend, replace, steal and collect). Players take advantage of their cards' abilities while racing to be first to line up three rows or columns of the same suit. Formation is a re-implementation of a game called Triumph, by the same designers.

boardgame.name: Arena of Octos
boardgame.description:
Arena of Octos is a single-player, turn-based combat video game for the Apple II and TRS-80 computer families. It was created by Steve Kropinak and Alan "Al" Johnston in 1981 and published by SoftSide magazine. Having worked out the premise of the game together, Johnston wrote the TRS-80 version and Kropinak the Apple II version. SoftSide paid Johnston and Kropinak $90 each for first publishing rights of the game's BASIC listing, and a further $90 to acquire the full rights to the programs.

In the game, you assume the role of a human space pilot, captured by an aggressive race of green-skinned aliens known as Octons after straying into their area of space. To win your freedom, you must become a gladiator and engage in physical combat with increasing numbers of Octon warriors. The computer controls the Octon warriors.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arena_of_Octos Arena of Octos]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.
